rename.from: :style with multiline attribute removes root element in IE 10
rename.to: :style with multiline attribute removes root element in all versions of IE

body:
Oh, I tried using the unminified version of Vue and it showed a helpful error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2098462/18439324/26f6f6e4-7905-11e6-9435-4a5851df0718.png)

`
` is the Line Feed Character (according to [this source](http://unicodelookup.com/#
/1)).

So the problem seems to be that IE/Edge transforms the Line Feeds into HTML entities, and the other browsers don't. Hope this helps.

Reproduction with unminified version: http://danieldiekmeier.de/vue/3.html

Well, this looks like an IE issue to me ðŸ˜„ 
The html spec says you **can** add whitespace and newlines to attrs. But IE seems to be ignoring this rule.
Having the console error looks enough to me. You can then use a computed property or put it all in one single line.

@posva I thought this was a recent Vue bug because v1.0.26 handles this just fine:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2098462/18443315/aa2ae156-7914-11e6-9904-1d14041ab3e2.png)

So it should be (and certainly was) possible, and this regression seems to be new. Did Vue 2 make fundamental changes to the way attributes are parsed?

Reproduction with uniminfied Vue v1.0.26: http://danieldiekmeier.de/vue/4.html

Oh, didn't know it worked on the previous version. Vue 2 is rewritten from scratch and uses Virtual dom to parse templates. Maybe Vue 1 actually handled that.
Can this be fixed easily for Vue 2 @yyx990803 ?
This is happening for me using Edge, Vue v2.4.2

issue.title: horizontal-tab in attribute argument causes 'Error compiling template' in Internet Explorer and Edge

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:
### Version 2.5.2 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/71870/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/71870/) ### Steps to reproduce this is the html that does not work: ```
``` this is the html that does work: ```
``` this is the JavaScript: ``` new Vue({ el: '#app' }) ``` ### What is expected? Vue should be able to compile the template no matter if a horizontal-tab is in the attribute or not ### What is actually happening? vue fails to compile template: ``` [Vue warn]: Error compiling template:
- invalid expression: Invalid character in true ? 'a' : '' Raw expression: v-bind:class="true ? 'a' : '' " (found in ) vue.js (577,7) ``` --- This happens in Internet Explorer and Edge. It works in Chrome and Firefox. Its related to this Bug: [:style with multiline attribute removes root element in all versions of IE #3663](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/3663) which has been fixed in: [handle multiline atribute value parsing in IE (fix #3663)](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/45ff6218c15f118d926a27ac90e274f3c999d77f) As seen in the error message it doesnt complain when there are ` ` in the template, but does on ` `. I ran into this bug because i write long attributes in multiple lines and use horizontal-tabs to indent these lines so its easier to read.

issue.title: fix(compiler): support decode all HTML entities in the value of prop and attribute (fix #8895)

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:
### Profitï¼š

1. Close #8895, #8805, #10121 and many issues about decoding HTML entities.
2. Go a step further to support decoding all the HTML entities in the value of prop and attribute. Ensuring consistent behavior between Vue.js and browser. Solving the HTML entities decode issue once and for all.
3. Optimizing the particular logic of fixing #3663 and #6828, simplify the code, improve the robustness.



### DEMOï¼š

#### Before Fixï¼šhttps://jsfiddle.net/juniortour/op1L4z3s/

#### After Fixï¼šhttps://jsfiddle.net/juniortour/qg9pwz7v/

<hr/>
